abstract: Despite prolonged troubles with fixed-income trading, Morgan Stanley has no plans to withdraw from the business, the firm’s chief executive told The Financial Times.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

lead_paragraph: Despite prolonged troubles with fixed-income trading, Morgan Stanley has no plans to withdraw from the business, according to the firm’s chief executive, James Gorman. “I don’t think it’s an option and I don’t think it’s wise,” he told The Financial Times in an interview, saying that it will stay in more “flow” parts of debt trading. “We actually have some convictions, we still take a lot of risk, we have an $800 billion balance sheet,” he added. headline.main: Morgan Stanley’s Chief Sticks by Debt Trading
